result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Langer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
If Defendant is released from custody late in the day and can't make probation today, he may report on 7/27/2015 in the morning.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Conditio of Probation.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Also to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Cases 14CT1203, 15CF797 and 15CM1100 were all dismissed and read into: 15CF132.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - credit for 26 days
TIME SERVED.
Perform as a Condition of Probation.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Sentence credit of 34 days was granted.

7/10/2017 - PER DOC REQUEST, COURT GRANTS A TOTAL OF 40 DAYS OF SENTENCE CREDIT.
Consecutive to: Present sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination. 
    If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
All costs/fees previously ordered by The Court are to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on this sentence.

superTimeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of extended supervision.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Sentencing after Revocation 4/3/17

Defendant Matthew D Langer in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 34 days) consecutive to present sentence;
 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
 2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

ALL COSTS/FEES PREVIOULSY ORDERED BY THE  COURT ARE TO BE PAID AS A CONDITON OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION ON THIS SENTENCE. 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation - maybe transferred to Milwaukee County. (Note: If defendant is released from custody late in the day and can't make it to probation today, he may report on 07/27/2015 in the a.m..)
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 26 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) - credit for 26 days - TIME SERVED.
